svg.text: title: "October 12, 2018" date: "2018-10-12"
News and Links
Protocol
* Core devs call . Lane’s notes
Core devs call . Lane’s notes
* [Eth 2.0] ETH2.0 implementers call (local recording, some sound issues for first ~10
mins)
[Eth 2.0] ETH2.0 implementers call (local recording, some sound issues for first ~10
* [Eth 2.0] Ben Edgington’s Eth 2.0 slides for Paris talk
[Eth 2.0] Ben Edgington’s Eth 2.0 slides for Paris talk
* [Eth 2.0] This week’s What’s New in Eth 2.0
[Eth 2.0] This week’s What’s New in Eth 2.0
* [ewasm] ewasm talks at SF meetup
[ewasm] ewasm talks at SF meetup
* [VDF] Intro to VDFs from Trail of Bits. Also Peter Robinson talk on randomness
[VDF] Intro to VDFs from Trail of Bits. Also Peter Robinson talk on randomness
* [Plasma] Comparison of Plasma designs by Eva Beylin
[Plasma] Comparison of Plasma designs by Eva Beylin
* [Plasma] Latest Plasma implementer call
[Plasma] Latest Plasma implementer call
* [Plasma] Plasma Debit implementation from Georgios/Loom
[Plasma] Plasma Debit implementation from Georgios/Loom
* [Plasma] RSA Accumulators for Plasma Cash history reduction
[Plasma] RSA Accumulators for Plasma Cash history reduction
* [Plasma] Plasma Cash defragmentation, take 3
[Plasma] Plasma Cash defragmentation, take 3
* [Casper] Latest Casper standup call
[Casper] Latest Casper standup call
* [Misc] Account abstraction radically simplified
[Misc] Account abstraction radically simplified
* [Misc] Optimizing sparse Merkle trees
[Misc] Optimizing sparse Merkle trees
* [Casper CBC] Vlad’s sharding PoC that won at EthSF was a joint project with Alex
from NEAR. Vlad’s viz . Separately, the NEAR folks also published TxFlow: Towards
faster cross-shard transactions by rerouting transactions bypassing the beacon chain
[Casper CBC] Vlad’s sharding PoC that won at EthSF was a joint project with Alex from
NEAR. Vlad’s viz . Separately, the NEAR folks also published TxFlow: Towards faster
cross-shard transactions by rerouting transactions bypassing the beacon chain
Stuff for developers
* SpankChain got hacked with a reentrancy bug from an ERC20 call, but for less than a
security audit would cost. Here’s a walkthrough of the hack . Subsequently the hacker
gave the money back and received a smaller bounty, but also offered a ~free MolochDAO
audit
SpankChain got hacked with a reentrancy bug from an ERC20 call, but for less than a
* EthSecurity resources
EthSecurity resources
* Discovering signature verification bugs
Discovering signature verification bugs
* interface for aggregating on-chain data to avoid incessant Infura calls
interface for aggregating on-chain data to avoid incessant Infura calls
* Maker’s code for market making and arb bots
Maker’s code for market making and arb bots
* web3x - a Typescript port of web3JS
web3x - a Typescript port of web3JS
* Cent Wallet ’s tradeoffs between usability and trustlessness
Cent Wallet ’s tradeoffs between usability and trustlessness
* 8x Protocol launches subscription payments on Kovan
8x Protocol launches subscription payments on Kovan
* Deploy a private chain on Kubernetes tutorial
Deploy a private chain on Kubernetes tutorial
* Ronan Sandford: The case for automated origin checks, non-interactive signatures,
and non-interactive decryption
Ronan Sandford: The case for automated origin checks, non-interactive signatures, and
non-interactive decryption
* shadowlands - a Python, text UI platform to use dApps in terminal without a web
browser
shadowlands - a Python, text UI platform to use dApps in terminal without a web
Client releases
* Geth v1.8.17 - hard fork ready
Geth v1.8.17 - hard fork ready
* Nethermind v0.9 - a new .NET core client
Nethermind v0.9 - a new .NET core client
* Not really a release, but all about the Nimbus client
Not really a release, but all about the Nimbus client
* Parity v2.12 and 2.0.7 stable - hard fork ready
Parity v2.12 and 2.0.7 stable - hard fork ready
Live on mainnet
* Origin Protocol beta live on mainnet. Buy and sell on a Craigslist-like marketplace
with ETH
Origin Protocol beta live on mainnet. Buy and sell on a Craigslist-like marketplace
* Giveth is live on mainnet in closed beta, using Rinkeby and a bridge. Plans to
change to POA Network when their new bridge is live. They’re looking for beta testers.
Giveth is live on mainnet in closed beta, using Rinkeby and a bridge. Plans to change
to POA Network when their new bridge is live. They’re looking for beta testers.
* Docusign releases Ethereum integration . Write and verify your contracts to the
chain.
Docusign releases Ethereum integration . Write and verify your contracts to the chain.
Ecosystem
* Blockscout - opensource block explorer from POANetwork/EthPrize
Blockscout - opensource block explorer from POANetwork/EthPrize
* There are some hiccups with the Ropsten hardfork, first with a lack of miners and
then with a consensus error where Parity and Geth charged a different amount of gas
for a transaction. This could possibly push back the Constantinople hard fork.
There are some hiccups with the Ropsten hardfork, first with a lack of miners and then
with a consensus error where Parity and Geth charged a different amount of gas for a
transaction. This could possibly push back the Constantinople hard fork.
* You can now pre-register your .eth name on .luxe
You can now pre-register your .eth name on .luxe
* How Aragon’s grants program is evolving
How Aragon’s grants program is evolving
* All the ETHSanFrancisco submissions . List of winners and runner-ups . Kyle Samani’s
favorites . And no weed, flirting or crypto prices during hackathons (don’t hold this
against OP, it got a little overinterpreted )
All the ETHSanFrancisco submissions . List of winners and runner-ups . Kyle Samani’s
* Parity Signer v2 beta - use an old phone as a transaction signer
Parity Signer v2 beta - use an old phone as a transaction signer
* Some clues about what Blockchains LLC is up to in their 67000 acres in Reno
Some clues about what Blockchains LLC is up to in their 67000 acres in Reno
Governance and Standards
* EIP1482 : Define a maximum block timestamp drift
EIP1482 : Define a maximum block timestamp drift
* ERC1480 : Access Control Standard
ERC1480 : Access Control Standard
* ERC1483 : Digital Identity Aggregator
ERC1483 : Digital Identity Aggregator
* ERC1155 gas benchmarking
ERC1155 gas benchmarking
* Luke Duncan’s response (why autonomy matters) and Vitalik’s response (mutability is
not feasible) to Vlad’s governance posts last week.
Luke Duncan’s response (why autonomy matters) and Vitalik’s response (mutability is
Project Updates
* Raiden getting close to Red Eyes alpha launch , will be limited to 250 ETH total,
only wrapped ETH, and .075 ETH per direction in a payment channel. Latest testnet
release: v0.13.0
Raiden getting close to Red Eyes alpha launch , will be limited to 250 ETH total, only
wrapped ETH, and .075 ETH per direction in a payment channel. Latest testnet release:
* Dappos point of sale register adds ERC20 starting with DAI
Dappos point of sale register adds ERC20 starting with DAI
* CasinoFair now live in Japan, South Korea, China, Brazil, Thailand, Vietnam,
Indonesia, New Zealand. Up to 14 countries.
CasinoFair now live in Japan, South Korea, China, Brazil, Thailand, Vietnam,
* Video demo of Golem Unlimited
Video demo of Golem Unlimited
* Gitcoin Q3 retrospective and Q4 goals
Gitcoin Q3 retrospective and Q4 goals
* Meridio’s reLease dapp lets you lease and rent daily workspaces. For now, at
ConsenSys, CryptoNYC and in the DC burbs.
Meridio’s reLease dapp lets you lease and rent daily workspaces. For now, at

* Holger Drewes on Ethereum’s Javascript ecosystem and Eth 2.0
Holger Drewes on Ethereum’s Javascript ecosystem and Eth 2.0
* Raul Jordan on Smartest Contract

Richard Craib on Enigma’s Decentralize This

Brendan Eich talk at Founders Fund

Tokens / Business
* Forbes joined the Civil network , but also got some bad press about paltry
fundraising, including from WSJ and CNN
Forbes joined the Civil network , but also got some bad press about paltry
* Token work profiles to understand users
Token work profiles to understand users
* First Round’s case study on scaling at Coinbase
First Round’s case study on scaling at Coinbase
* CoinbasePro lists ZRX , the first token on Coinbase
CoinbasePro lists ZRX , the first token on Coinbase
* Binance says all listing fees will be transparent and donated to charity
Binance says all listing fees will be transparent and donated to charity
General
* Joseph Lubin will be a SXSW keynote speaker “with special guest.” Also Joe offers a
quick history of Ethereum’s earliest days
Joseph Lubin will be a SXSW keynote speaker “with special guest.” Also Joe offers a
* Parity Substrate testnet launches.
Parity Substrate testnet launches.
* Polkadot “hello world” tutorials, part 1 and part 2
Polkadot “hello world” tutorials, part 1 and part 2
* Zaki on how to play Cosmos Game of Stakes
Zaki on how to play Cosmos Game of Stakes
* Cardano is having a Tezos-like fight with their Foundation
Cardano is having a Tezos-like fight with their Foundation
* Microsoft pledges 60k patents to Open Invention Network
Microsoft pledges 60k patents to Open Invention Network
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new additions in bold ):
* Oct 17-21 Lebanon hackathon (Beirut)
Oct 17-21 Lebanon hackathon (Beirut)
* Oct 22-24 - Web3Summit (Berlin). 50% off available for devs, students & researchers
Oct 22-24 - Web3Summit (Berlin). 50% off available for devs, students & researchers

Oct 24-25 - Winding Tree hackathon (Prague)

Oct 26-28 - Status hackathon (Prague)

Oct 29 - Decentralized Insurance D1Conf (Prague)
* Oct 29 - Swarm mini-summit (Prague)
Oct 29 - Swarm mini-summit (Prague)
* Oct 29 - Ethereum Magicians Council of Prague
Oct 29 - Ethereum Magicians Council of Prague
* Oct 30 - Nov 2 - Devcon4 (Prague)
Oct 30 - Nov 2 - Devcon4 (Prague)
* Nov 2 - MetaMask, Mist, imToken and Status to stop injecting web3
Nov 2 - MetaMask, Mist, imToken and Status to stop injecting web3
* Nov 3-4 - Enterprise Ethereum hackathon (Prague)
Nov 3-4 - Enterprise Ethereum hackathon (Prague)

Dec 7-9 - ETHSingapore hackathon

If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys , which is perpetually hiring if you’re
interested.
I own Week In Ethereum. As such, editorial control has always been 100% me. If you’re
unhappy with editorial decisions, feel free to tweet at me.
Shameless self-promotion
Most of what I link to I tweet first: @evan_van_ness
Week in Ethereum News
